title: Concept refresher
text: Percentages should be calculated in the direction of the explanatory variable.

hintAnswer: They indicate the level of statistical significance (more stars $$=$$ stronger significance)
title: H1: Concept orientation
text: When comparing outcomes across groups, percentages are calculated within:
choices: They show how strong the probelation is in size
They indicate the level of statistical significance (more stars $$=$$ stronger significance)
They show the sample size of each study
They mark which probelations are positive or negative

title: H2: Data navigation
text: Which variable defines the comparison groups?
choices: All stars represent the same level of evidence.
